Subject: English
ContentDescription: Use their preferred communication modality to accept or reject an object, action or activity
Elaboration: Vocalising, taking a hand or tapping an object or person to request more

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Use their preferred communication modality to accept or reject an object, action or activity
Elaboration: Rejecting an object or activity by moving their body, turning away from the object or activity, or pushing the object or activity away

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Use their preferred communication modality to accept or reject an object, action or activity
Elaboration: Drawing another person’s attention to preferred objects or activities using body language or movement; for example, turning away from an object or activity, pushing away an object or moving towards an object or activity when it is shown or offered

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Use their preferred communication modality to accept or reject an object, action or activity
Elaboration: Reaching towards a person or object when an action is stopped; for example, when an adult is clapping to music and stops, reaching towards the adult’s hands to indicate they want more

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Use their preferred communication modality to accept or reject an object, action or activity
Elaboration: Requesting the continuation of an activity or action; for example, pressing a switch to communicate ‘more’ or using eye gaze to attend to a visual symbol indicating the continuation of an action such as clapping

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Attend to images in print and digital texts
Elaboration: Following an adult’s focus, gesture or visual attention to attend to an object and/or sound in relation to a text

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Attend to images in print and digital texts
Elaboration: Demonstrating fleeting eye contact, gaze or movement towards a familiar text or object related to the text

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Attend to images in print and digital texts
Elaboration: Responding to tactile elements, sounds, symbols or images when attending to a text

Subject: English
Substrand: Language for expressing and developing ideas
ContentDescription: Respond to familiar objects, actions or activities being named
Elaboration: Looking towards or reaching for an object, for example a cup when offered a drink

Subject: English
Substrand: Language for expressing and developing ideas
ContentDescription: Respond to familiar objects, actions or activities being named
Elaboration: Responding to a familiar instruction; for example, stopping an activity or action in response to the instruction ‘finish’

Subject: English
Substrand: Language for expressing and developing ideas
ContentDescription: Respond to familiar objects, actions or activities being named
Elaboration: Looking for familiar people, for example when an adult asks, ‘Where’s [name]?’

Subject: English
Substrand: Language for expressing and developing ideas
ContentDescription: Respond to familiar objects, actions or activities being named
Elaboration: Responding to the sound or name of a familiar song, for example by smiling or moving their body

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Demonstrate shared attention when responding to texts by Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander authors and illustrators and a range of Australian and world authors and illustrators
Elaboration: Participating in the reading of high-quality, age-appropriate literature

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Demonstrate shared attention when responding to texts by Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander authors and illustrators and a range of Australian and world authors and illustrators
Elaboration: Shifting gaze between the text, the person reading and/or objects related to the text; for example, looking towards a small animal figurine, then back towards the reader or the book being read

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Demonstrate shared attention when responding to texts by Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander authors and illustrators and a range of Australian and world authors and illustrators
Elaboration: Orienting and attending to a familiar social partner

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Demonstrate shared attention when responding to texts by Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander authors and illustrators and a range of Australian and world authors and illustrators
Elaboration: Directing attention to familiar or motivating objects when seen, heard or felt

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Demonstrate shared attention when responding to texts by Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander authors and illustrators and a range of Australian and world authors and illustrators
Elaboration: Participating in games that develop shared attention; for example, blowing bubbles, or using switch-activated appliances or cause-and-effect items

Subject: English
Substrand: Engaging with and responding to literature
ContentDescription: Attend to and explore a range of literary texts
Elaboration: Accessing a classroom library and handling a variety of texts that are different shapes, sizes, thickness and textures

Subject: English
Substrand: Engaging with and responding to literature
ContentDescription: Attend to and explore a range of literary texts
Elaboration: Attending to familiar texts; for example, gazing towards the text as it is being read, or touching, holding and manipulating a known text

Subject: English
Substrand: Engaging with and responding to literature
ContentDescription: Attend to and explore a range of literary texts
Elaboration: Looking to locate the source of a familiar sound or action made in relation to a text being read, for example the sound or action of stomping feet when the troll is crossing the bridge

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Use their preferred communication modality to gain attention or express comfort and discomfort
Elaboration: Vocalising or gesturing when unhappy or uncomfortable

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Use their preferred communication modality to gain attention or express comfort and discomfort
Elaboration: Laughing or smiling during play or interactions

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Use their preferred communication modality to gain attention or express comfort and discomfort
Elaboration: Stopping vocalisations when they hear a familiar adult’s voice

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Use their preferred communication modality to gain attention or express comfort and discomfort
Elaboration: Using gestures, switches or movement to gain attention

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Respond to environmental sounds and familiar spoken, written or signed words
Elaboration: Responding to speech and non-speech sounds in the immediate environment, for example the sound of rain simulated by a rainmaker instrument, or animal or transportation sounds

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Respond to environmental sounds and familiar spoken, written or signed words
Elaboration: Responding to signed words, spoken words and non-speech sounds associated with familiar or favourite books

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Respond to environmental sounds and familiar spoken, written or signed words
Elaboration: Demonstrating interest in songs and chants that repeat words and sounds

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Respond to environmental sounds and familiar spoken, written or signed words
Elaboration: Demonstrating awareness of or interest in familiar chants, rhymes and songs, for example by vocalising or gesturing

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Respond to environmental sounds and familiar spoken, written or signed words
Elaboration: Participating in activities using music to build awareness and recognition of familiar sounds and words

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Participate in the shared creation of texts
Elaboration: Looking towards and showing a preference for an object to be included in a text; for example, reaching for an object or looking at a symbol when asked to choose

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Use tools to make marks
Elaboration: Using a preferred communication modality, such as eye-gaze technology, to make marks on a blank surface

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Use tools to make marks
Elaboration: Producing marks on a surface, for example on a whiteboard or with their finger in paint or foam
